name: undeserving
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
not having earned the right to have something; not deserving something: They have been shown to be groups undeserving of any respect whatsoever. Many of them felt that the welfare state benefited the undeserving more than the needy.
More examplesFewer examplesIt was, overall, a disappointing meal, and undeserving of the high rating others had given.He insists the team will be undeserving champions if they clinch the title on Sunday.Judges and juries are often subject to ill-informed criticism for making unduly generous awards to undeserving plaintiffs.As Prime Minister, he picked a fight with the undeserving rich on behalf of the deserving poor.
